comment.body: On my side, looks like the rule that causes issue is `||cl*.k5a.io^$third-party`, not `/snowplow/*$script` ?

labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body: ### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.templatesarea.com/wedding-rings-dwg-free-cad-block-cnc-cutting-file/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.templatesarea.com%2Fwedding-rings-dwg-free-cad-block-cnc-cutting-file%2F) ### Comment > Hello AdGuard team, > > I operate a website where I freely share my own original designs, which I hold all legal rights to. Instead of selling these resources, I provide them for free to a wide range of industries and creators, including with free commercial licenses for production use. > > However, I have noticed that AdGuard is applying aggressive filter rules to my site, which break core site functionality and prevent users from benefiting from these resources. What is especially concerning is that my site is being grouped under the same filter rules as adult content sites and illegal streaming domains. This unfairly impacts a legitimate resource intended for professionals, educators, and makers. > > I have already removed any adblock detection scripts from my website to avoid conflicts. > > Here are the filters currently affecting my domains: > > Element:
